setting.name: date.format
setting.label: 24 Hour Time
setting.type: "string which includes 'D', 'd' and 'M' and two optional comma's "
setting.description: Controls format of date string. D = day of week d = day M = month Up to two comma's may be included. e.g. D,dM = Thursday, 3 July Md,D = July 3, Thursday The field may contain 0, 1 or 2 comma's which can occur only between characters and only one at a time i.e. 'D,,dM' is illegal.

setting.name: date.longFormat
setting.description: If 1, display the day and month in long format (Friday/November), otherwise, use abbreviations (Fri/Nov).

setting.name: date.dateTop
setting.description: If 1, display date above time else display time above date.

setting.name: headsetMode
setting.description: If set to 1, the headset will be selected as the preferred transducer after its first use until the headset key is pressed again; otherwise, handsfree will be selected preferentially over the headset.

setting.name: useDirectoryNames
setting.description: If set to 1, the name fields of directory entries which match incoming calls will be used for caller identification display and in the call lists instead of the name provided via network signaling.

setting.name: oneTouchVoiceMail
setting.description: If set to 1, the voicemail summary display is bypassed and voicemail is dialed directly (if configured).

setting.name: welcomeSoundEnabled
setting.description: If set to 1, play welcome sound effect after a reboot.

setting.name: welcomeSoundOnWarmBootEnabled
setting.description: If set to 1, play welcome sound effect on warm as well as cold boots, otherwise only a cold boot will trigger the welcome sound effect.

setting.name: localClockEnabled
setting.description: If set to 1, display the date and time on the idle display

setting.name: level
setting.description: Level of the high frequency compo-nent of the DTMF digit measured in dBm0; the low frequency tone will be two dB lower.

setting.name: onTime
setting.description: When a sequence of DTMF tones is played out automatically, this is the length of time in milliseconds the tones will be generated for; this is also the minimum time the tone will be played for when dialing manually (even if key press is shorter).

setting.name: offTime
setting.description: When a sequence of DTMF tones is played out automatically, this is the length of time in milliseconds the phone will pause between digits; this is also the minimum inter-digit time when dialing manually.

setting.name: chassis.masking
setting.description: If set to 1, DTMF tones will be sub-stituted with a non-DTMF pacifier tone when dialing in hands-free mode. This prevents DTMF digits being broadcast to other surrounding telephony devices or being inadvert-ently transmitted in-band due to local acoustic echo. Note: tone.dtmf.chassis.masking should only be enabled when tone.dtmf.viaRtp is disabled.

setting.name: stim.pac.offHookOnly
setting.description: Not currently used.

setting.name: viaRtp
setting.description: If set to 1, encode DTMF in the active RTP stream, otherwise, DTMF may be encoded within the signaling protocol only when the protocol offers the option. Note: tone.dtmf.chassis.masking should be enabled when tone.dtmf.viaRtp is disabled.

setting.name: rfc2833Control
setting.description: If set to 1, the phone will indicate a preference for encoding DTMF via RFC 2833 format in its Session Description Protocol (SDP) offers by showing support for the phone-event payload type; this does not affect SDP answers, these will always honor the DTMF format present in the offer since the phone has native support for RFC 2833.

setting.name: rfc2833Payload
setting.description: The phone-event payload encoding in the dynamic range to be used in SDP offers.

group.name: se
group.label: Sound Effects
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP uses both synthesized (based on the chord-sets described earlier) and sampled audio sound effects. Sound effects are defined by patterns: rudimentary sequences of chord-sets, silence periods, and wave files.

setting.name: stutterOnVoiceMail
setting.description: If set to 1, stuttered dial tone is used in place of normal dial tone to indicate that one or more messages (voice-mail) are waiting at the message center.

setting.name: appLocalEnabled
setting.description: If set to 1, local user interface sound effects such as confirmation/error tones, will be enabled.

setting.name: codecPref.G711Mu
setting.description: Specifies the codec preference. 1=highest 3=lowest Null=do not use Give each codec a unique priority, this will dictate the order used in SDP negotiations. Note: If less than two codecs are specified, SoundPoint(R) IP will automatically use G711Mu and G711A with default parameters.

setting.name: codecPref.G711A
setting.description: Specifies the codec preference. 1=highest 3=lowest Null=do not use Give each codec a unique priority, this will dictate the order used in SDP negotiations. Note: If less than two codecs are specified, SoundPoint(R) IP will automatically use G711Mu and G711A with default parameters.

setting.name: codecPref.G729AB
setting.description: Specifies the codec preference. 1=highest 3=lowest Null=do not use Give each codec a unique priority, this will dictate the order used in SDP negotiations. Note: If less than two codecs are specified, SoundPoint(R) IP will automatically use G711Mu and G711A with default parameters.

setting.name: audioProfile.x.payloadSize
setting.description: Preferred Tx payload size in milliseconds to be provided in SDP offers and used in the absence of ptime negotiations. This is also the range of supported Rx payload sizes.

setting.name: audioProfile.x.jitterBufferMin
setting.description: The smallest jitter buffer depth (in milli-seconds) that must be achieved before play out begins for the first time. Once this depth has been achieved initially, the depth may fall below this point and play out will still continue. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value which is at least two packet pay-loads, and larger than the expected short term average jitter.

setting.name: audioProfile.x.jitterBufferShrink
setting.description: The absolute minimum duration time (in milliseconds) of RTP packet Rx with no packet loss between jitter buffer size shrinks. Use smaller values (1000 ms) to minimize the delay on known good networks. Use larger values to minimize packet loss on networks with large jitter (3000 ms).

setting.name: audioProfile.x.jitterBufferMax
setting.type: greater than jitterBuf-ferMin, multiple of 10, less than or =500 for IP 500 and IP 600, less than or = 160 for IP 300
setting.description: The largest jitter buffer depth to be sup-ported (in milliseconds). Jitter above this size will always cause lost packets. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value that will support the expected network jitter

group.name: volume
group.label: Volume Persistence
group.description: The user's selection of the receive volume during a call can be remembered between calls. This can be configured per termination (handset, headset and handsfree/chassis). In some countries regulations exist which dictate that receive volume should be reset to nominal at the start of each call on handset and headset.

setting.name: persist.handset
setting.description: If set to 1, the receive volume will be remembered between calls. If set to 0, the receive volume will be reset to nominal at the start of each call.

setting.name: persist.headset
setting.description: If set to 1, the receive volume will be remembered between calls. If set to 0, the receive volume will be reset to nominal at the start of each call.

setting.name: persist.handsfree
setting.description: If set to 1, the receive volume will be remembered between calls. If set to 0, the receive volume will be reset to nominal at the start of each call.

group.name: vad
group.label: Voice Activity Detection
group.description: These settings control the performance of the voice activity detection (silence suppres-sion) feature

setting.name: vadEnable
setting.description: If set to 1, enable VAD.

setting.name: vadThresh
setting.description: The threshold for determining what is active voice and what is background noise in dB. This does not apply to G.729AB codec operation which has its own built-in VAD function.

setting.name: ethernet.rtp.user_priority
setting.description: User-priority used for RTP packets.

setting.name: ethernet.callControl.user_priority
setting.description: User-priority used for call control packets.

setting.name: ethernet.other.user_priority
setting.description: User-priority used for packets that do not have a per-protocol setting.

setting.name: ip.rtp.min_delay
setting.description: If set to 1, set min-delay bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.rtp.max_throughput
setting.description: If set to 1, set max-throughput bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.rtp.max_reliability
setting.description: If set to 1, set max-reliability bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.rtp.min_cost
setting.description: If set to 1, set min-cost bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.rtp.precedence
setting.description: If set to 1, set precedence bits in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set them.

setting.name: ip.callControl.min_delay
setting.description: If set to 1, set min-delay bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.callControl.max_throughput
setting.description: If set to 1, set max-throughput bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.callControl.max_reliability
setting.description: If set to 1, set max-reliability bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.callControl.min_cost
setting.description: If set to 1, set min-cost bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: ip.callControl.precedence
setting.description: If set to 1, set precedence bits in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set them.

group.name: tcpIpApp.sntp
group.label: Time Synchronization
group.description: The following table describes the parameters used to set up time synchronization and daylight savings time. The defaults shown will enable daylight savings time for North America. Daylight savings defaults

setting.name: resyncPeriod
setting.description: Time in seconds between SNTP re-syncs.

setting.name: address
setting.type: a valid host name or IP address
setting.description: Address of the SNTP server.

setting.name: gmtOffset
setting.description: Offset in seconds of the local time zone from GMT. Note: 3600 seconds per hour

setting.name: daylightSavings.enable
setting.description: If set to 1, apply day-light savings rules to displayed time.

setting.name: daylightSavings.fixedDayEnable
setting.description: If set to 1, 'April 1st' is used, otherwise 'the first Sunday in April' is used.

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.month
setting.description: Month to start DST. 1=Jan, 2=Feb, ..., 12=Dec

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.date
setting.description: Day of the month to start DST.

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.time
setting.description: Time of day to start DST, in 24 hour clock. 2=2 am, 14=2 pm

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.dayOfWeek
setting.description: Day of week to apply DST. 1=Sun, 2=Mon, ..., 7=Sat

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.dayOfWeek.lastInMonth
setting.description: If set to 1 and fixedDayEnable=0, start DST on the last day of the week (specified by dayOf- Week) in the month, rather than the first in the month.

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.month
setting.description: Month to stop DST. 1=Jan, 2=Feb, ..., 12=Dec

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.date
setting.description: Day of the month to start DST.

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.time
setting.description: Time of day to stop DST, in 24 hour clock. 2= 2 am, 14=2 pm

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.dayOfWeek
setting.description: Day of week to stop DST. 1=Sun, 2=Mon, ..., 7=Sat

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.dayOfWeek.lastInMonth
setting.description: If set to 1 and fixedDay- Enable=0, stop DST on the last day of the week (specified by dayOf- Week) in the month, rather than the first in the month.

setting.name: port.rtp.filterByIp
setting.description: If set to 1, reject RTP pack-ets arriving from (sent from) a non-negotiated (via SDP) IP address.

setting.name: rtp.filterByPort
setting.description: If set to 1, reject RTP pack-ets arriving from (sent from) a non-negotiated (via SDP) port.

setting.name: rtp.forceSend
setting.description: When non-Null, send all RTP packets to, and expect all RTP packets to arrive on, the specified port. Note: both tcpIpApp.port.rtp.filter- ByIp and tcpI-pApp.port.rtp.filterByPort must be enabled for this to work.

setting.name: rtp.mediaPortRangeStart
setting.description: If set to Null, the value 2222 will be used for the first allo-cated RTP port, otherwise, the specified port will be used. Subsequent ports will be allocated from a pool starting with the specified port plus two up to a value of (start-port + 46), after which the port number will wrap back to the starting value.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, the HTTP server will be enabled.

setting.name: cfg.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, the HTTP server configuration interface will be enabled.

setting.name: cfg.port
setting.description: Port is 80 for HTTP servers. Care should be taken when choosing an alternate port.

setting.name: donotdisturb.perReg
setting.label: Do Not Disturb
setting.description: If set to 1, the DND feature will allow selection of DND on a per-registration basis.

setting.name: rejectBusyOnDnd
setting.description: If set to 1, reject all incoming calls with the reason 'busy' if do-not-disturb is enabled.

setting.name: enableOnNotRegistered
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be allowed when the phone is not successfully registered, other-wise, calls will not be permitted without a valid registration.

setting.name: offeringTimeOut
setting.description: Time in seconds to allow an incoming call to ring before dropping the call, 0=infinite.

setting.name: ringBackTimeOut
setting.description: Time in seconds to allow an outgoing call to remain in the ringback state before dropping the call, 0=infinite.

setting.name: lastCallReturnString
setting.description: The string sent to the server when the user selects the 'last call return' action.

setting.name: shared.disableDivert
setting.description: If set to 1, disable diversion feature for shared lines.

setting.name: shared.seizeFailReorder
setting.description: If set to 1, play re-order tone locally on shared line seize failure.

setting.name: shared.oneTouchResume
setting.description: If set to 1, when a shared line has a call on hold the remote user can press that line and resume the call. If more than one call is on hold on the line then the first one will be selected and resumed automatically. If set to 0, pressing the shared line will bring up a list of the calls on that line and the user can select which call the next action should be applied to. The call diversion, no answer feature will take precedence over this feature if enabled.

setting.name: localReminder.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, periodically notify the local user that calls have been on hold for an extended period of time.

setting.name: localReminder.period
setting.description: Time in seconds between subsequent reminders.

setting.name: localReminder.startDelay
setting.description: Time in seconds to wait before the initial reminder.

setting.name: scrolling.timeout
setting.description: The time-out after which a key that is enabled for scrolling will go into scrolling mode until the key is released. Keys enabled for scrolling are menu navigation keys (left, right, up, down arrows), volume keys, and some context-spe-cific soft keys. The value is an integer multiple of 500 milliseconds (1=500ms).

setting.name: level.change.sip
setting.label: SIP Logging
setting.description: This attribute controls the logging detail level for the SIP component. These are the input filters for the internal memory-based log system.

setting.name: render.level
setting.description: Specifies the lowest class of event that will be rendered to the log files. This is the output filter from the internal mem-ory-based log system.

setting.name: render.type
setting.description: See above table for timestamp type.

setting.name: render.realtime
setting.description: Set to 1. Do not change.

setting.name: render.stdout
setting.description: Set to 1. Do not change.

setting.name: render.file
setting.description: Set to 1. Do not change.

setting.name: render.file.size
setting.description: Maximum local application log file size in Kbytes. When this size is exceeded, the file is uploaded to the boot server and the local copy is erased.

setting.name: render.file.upload.period
setting.description: Time in seconds between log file uploads to the boot server. Note: The log file will not be uploaded if no new events have been logged since the last upload.

setting.name: render.file.upload.append
setting.description: If set to 1, use append mode when uploading log files to server.

setting.name: render.file.upload.append.sizeLimit
setting.description: Maximum log file size on boot server in Kbytes.

setting.name: render.file.upload.append.limitMode
setting.description: Behavior when server log file has reached its limit. delete=delete file and start over, stop=stop appending to file.

group.name: sec
group.label: Security
group.description: These settings affect security aspects of SoundPoint(R) IP.

setting.name: tagSerialNo
setting.description: If set to 1, the phone may advertise its serial num-ber (Ethernet address) via protocol signaling.

setting.name: pwd.length.admin
setting.description: Password changes will need to be at least this long. Use 0 to allow null passwords.

setting.name: pwd.length.user
setting.description: Password changes will need to be at least this long. Use 0 to allow null passwords.

setting.name: delay.type
setting.description: Defines the strategy to adopt before a request gets executed. If set to 'audio', a request can be exe-cuted as soon as there is no active audio on the phone, independently of any call state. If set to 'call', a request can be executed as soon as there are no calls in any state on the phone.

group.name: mb
group.label: MicroBrowser
group.description: These settings control the home page and proxy to be used by the MicroBrowser when it is selected to provide services and also when it is used as part of the Idle Display. They also control size limits and the Idle Display refresh rate.

setting.name: proxy
setting.type: Null or domain name or IP address in the format address:port
setting.description: Address of the desired HTTP proxy to be used by the MicroBrowser. If blank, nor-mal unproxied HTTP is used by the MicroBrowser.

setting.name: idleDisplay.home
setting.type: Null, or any fully formed valid HTTP URL. Length up to 255 characters.
setting.description: URL used for MicroBrowser idle display home-page. Example: http://www.example.com/ xhtml/frontpage.cgi?page=home. If empty, there will be no microbrowser idle display feature. Note that the MicroBrowser idle display will displace the idle display indicator. See Indicators settings.

setting.name: idleDisplay.refresh
setting.description: The period in seconds between refreshes of the idle display MicroBrowser's con-tent. 0 = the idle display MicroBrowser is not refreshed. Minimum refresh period = 5 seconds (values from 1 to 4 will be ignored, and 5 will be used instead) Notes: If an HTTP Refresh header is detected, it will be respected, even if this parameter is set to 0. The use of this parameter in combination with the Refresh HTTP header may cause the idle display to refresh at unexpected times.

setting.name: main.home
setting.type: Any fully formed valid HTTP URL. Length up to 255 characters.
setting.description: URL used for MicroBrowser home-page. If blank, the browser will notify the user that a blank home-page was used. Example: http://www.example.com/ xhtml/frontpage.cgi?page=home.

setting.name: limits.nodes
setting.description: Limits the number of tags which the XML parser will handle. This limits the amount of memory used by complicated pages. The Services browser and the Idle Display each use memory defined by this limit. A maximum total of 500 (256 each) is recommended. Increasing this value may have a detrimental effect on perfor-mance of the phone.

setting.name: limits.cache
setting.description: Limits the total size of objects down-loaded for each page (both XHTML and images). Once this limit is reached, no more images are downloaded until the next page is requested. Units = kBytes. Increasing this value may have a detri-mental effect on performance of the phone.

setting.name: address
setting.label: Server
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that accepts registrations. Multiple servers can be listed starting with for fault tolerance. If port is 0 or Null: If Address is a hostname and Transport is set to DNSnaptr, do NAPTR then SRV lookups. If Transport is set to TCPpreferred or UDPonly then use 5060 and don't advertise the port number in signalling. If Address is an IP address, there is no DNS lookup and 5060 is used for the port but it is not advertised in signaling. If port is 1 to 65535: This value is used and it is advertised in signaling.

setting.name: transport
setting.description: If set to Null or DNSnaptr: If Address is a hostname and Port is 0 or Null, do NAPTR then SRV look-ups to try to discover the transport, ports and servers, as per RFC 3263. If Address is an IP address, or a port is given, then UDP is used. If set to TCPpreferred: TCP is the preferred transport, UDP is used if TCP fails. If set to UDPonly: Only UDP will be used.

setting.name: expires
setting.description: Requested registration period in seconds. This is SoundPoint(R) IP's requested registration period. The period negotiated with the server may be different. SoundPoint(R) IP will attempt to re-register when half the negotiated period has expired.

setting.name: register
setting.description: If set to 0, calls can be routed to an outbound proxy without registration.

setting.name: retryTimeOut
setting.description: If set to 0 or Null, use standard RFC 3261 signaling retry behavior. Otherwise retryTimeOut determines how often retries will be sent. Units = milliSeconds. (Finest resolution = 100ms).

setting.name: retryMaxCount
setting.description: If set to 0 or Null, 3 is used. retryMaxCount retries will be attempted before moving on to the next available server.

setting.name: expires.lineSeize
setting.description: Requested line-seize subscription period.

setting.name: address
setting.label: Server
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: Backup IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that accepts registrations. Multiple servers can be listed starting with for fault tolerance. If port is 0 or Null: If Address is a hostname and Transport is set to DNSnaptr, do NAPTR then SRV lookups. If Transport is set to TCPpreferred or UDPonly then use 5060 and don't advertise the port number in signalling. If Address is an IP address, there is no DNS lookup and 5060 is used for the port but it is not advertised in signaling. If port is 1 to 65535: This value is used and it is advertised in signaling.

setting.name: transport
setting.description: If set to Null or DNSnaptr: If Address is a hostname and Port is 0 or Null, do NAPTR then SRV look-ups to try to discover the transport, ports and servers, as per RFC 3263. If Address is an IP address, or a port is given, then UDP is used. If set to TCPpreferred: TCP is the preferred transport, UDP is used if TCP fails. If set to UDPonly: Only UDP will be used.

setting.name: expires
setting.description: Requested registration period in seconds. This is SoundPoint(R) IP's requested registration period. The period negotiated with the server may be different. SoundPoint(R) IP will attempt to re-register when half the negotiated period has expired.

setting.name: register
setting.description: If set to 0, calls can be routed to an outbound proxy without reg-istration.

setting.name: retryTimeOut
setting.description: If set to 0 or Null, use standard RFC 3261 signaling retry behavior. Otherwise retryTim-eOut determines how often retries will be sent. Units = milliSeconds. (Finest resolution = 100ms).

setting.name: retryMaxCount
setting.description: If set to 0 or Null, 3 is used. retryMaxCount retries will be attempted before moving on to the next available server.

setting.name: expires.lineSeize
setting.description: Requested line-seize subscription period.

setting.name: address
setting.label: Server
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server to which the phone shall send all requests for making calls.

setting.name: port
setting.label: Local Port
setting.description: Local port for sending and receiving SIP signaling packets. If set to 0 or Null, 5060 is used for the local port but it is not advertised in the SIP signaling. If set to some other value, that value is used for the local port and it is advertised in the SIP signaling.

setting.name: useRFC2543hold
setting.description: If set to 1, use the obsolete c=0.0.0.0 RFC2543 technique, otherwise, use SDP media direction attributes (such as a=sendonly) per RFC 3264 when initiating hold. In either case, the phone processes incoming hold signaling in either format.

setting.name: lcs
setting.description: If set to 1, the proprietary 'epid' parameter is added to the From field of all requests to support Windows Live Communications Server.

setting.name: sendCompactHdrs
setting.description: If set to 0, SIP header names generated by the phone use the long form, for example 'From'. If set to 1, SIP header names generated by the phone use the short form, for example 'f'.

setting.name: WM50
setting.description: Windows Messaging 5.0 Compatability

setting.name: x.value
setting.type: string to compare against the value of Alert-Info headers in INVITE requests
setting.description: Alert-Info fields from INVITE requests will be compared against as many of these parameters as are specified (x=1, 2, ..., N) and if a match is found, the behavior described in the corresponding ring class will be applied.

setting.name: x.request
setting.description: Sets the name of the method for which validation will be applied. WARNING: Intensive request validation may have a negative performance impact due to the additional signaling required in some cases, therefore, use it judiciously.

setting.name: x.method
setting.description: If Null, no validation is done. Otherwise this sets the type of validation performed for the request: source: ensure request is received from an IP address of a server belonging to the set of target registration servers; digest: challenge requests with digest authentication using the local credentials for the associated registration (line); both or all: apply both of the above methods

setting.name: x.request.y.event
setting.description: Determines which events specified with the Event header should be validated; only applicable when voIp- Prot.SIP.requestValida-tion.x.request is set to 'SUBSCRIBE' or 'NOTIFY'. If set to Null, all events will be validated.

setting.name: digest.realm
setting.description: Determines string used for Realm.

setting.name: lineSeize.nonStandard
setting.description: If set to 1, process a 200 OK response for a line-seize event SUBSCRIBE as though a line-seize NOTIFY with Subscription State: active header had been received, this speeds up processing.

setting.name: checkSync.alwaysReboot
setting.description: If set to 1, always reboot when a NOTIFY message is received from the server with event equal to check-sync. If set to 0, only reboot if any of the files listed in [mac].cfg have changed on the FTP server when a NOTIFY message is received from the server with event equal to check-sync.

setting.name: address
setting.type: ASCII string up to 128 characters long
setting.description: If Null, conferences are set up on the phone locally. If set to some value, conferences are set up by the server using the conferencing agent specified by this address. The acceptable values depend on the conferencing server implementation policy.

group.name: dialplan
group.label: Dial Plan
group.description: Dialplan for all lines on this phone. Each line may be configured independenty, see that lines settings.

setting.name: impossibleMatchHandling
setting.description: If set to 0, the digits entered up to and including the point where an impossible match occurred are sent to the server immediately. If set to 1, give reorder tone. If set to 2, allow user to accumulate digits and dispatch call manually with the Send soft key.

setting.name: removeEndOfDial
setting.description: If set to 1, strip trailing # digit from digits sent out.

setting.name: digitmap
setting.type: string compatible with the digit map feature of MGCP described in 2.1.5 of RFC 3435. String is limited to 512 bytes and 20 segments; a comma is also allowed; when reached in the digit map, a comma will turn dial tone back on.
setting.description: When this attribute is present, number-only dialing during the setup phase of new calls will be compared against the patterns therein and if a match is found, the call will be initiated automatically eliminating the need to press Send.

setting.name: digitmap.timeOut
setting.label: Time out
setting.description: Timeout in seconds for 'T' feature of digitmap.

setting.name: address
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that will be used for routing calls.

setting.name: emergency.1.value
setting.label: Emergency Numbers
setting.type: Comma separated list of entries or single entry representing a SIP URL or a combination of SIP URLs.
setting.description: This determines the URLs that should be watched for. When one of these defined URLs is detected as having been dialed by the user, the call will automatically be directed to the defined emergency server.

group.name: msg
group.label: Messaging
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP supports message-waiting indication on a per-registration basis.

setting.name: bypassInstantMessage
setting.description: If set to 1, the display offering a choice of 'Message Center' and 'Instant Messages' will be bypassed when pressing the Messages key, the phone will act as if 'Message Center' was chosen. See 3.6.1 Voicemail Integration on page 49. Instant Messages will still be accessible from the Main Menu.

group.name: nat
group.label: Network Address Translation
group.description: These parameters define port and IP address changes used in NAT traversal. The port changes will change the port used by the phone, while the IP entry simply changes the IP advertised in the SIP signaling. This allows the use of simple NAT devices that can redirect traffic, but do not allow for port mapping. For example, port 5432 on the NAT device can be sent to port 5432 on an internal device, but not port 1234.

setting.name: ip
setting.description: IP address to advertise within SIP signaling - should match the external IP address used by the NAT device.

setting.name: signalPort
setting.description: If non-Null, this port will be used by the phone for SIP signaling, overriding the value set for RTP Settings

setting.name: mediaPortStart
setting.description: If non-Null, this attribute will be used to set the initially allocated RTP port, overriding the value set in RTP Settings.
